<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros. [/INST]</s>                               5.192v
<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP3V3_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger [/INST]</s>                                                    3.403v
<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the <s>[INST] [CHIPS]CD3215[/CHIPS]: This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v. [/INST]</s> USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. [/INST]</s>                                    3.371v
